revised_title: Monthly Rainfall Measurements in Gresham College, London (1695)
tldr: This article presents a detailed account of the rainfall measurements taken at Gresham College, London, from August 12, 1695, to August 12, 1696. The author records the quantities of rain in pounds, ounces, and grains, using a specially designed vessel with a diameter of 11 inches and 4/10. The study provides valuable historical data for understanding the climate of the time.
